citation.article-title: Mycoplasma microti sp. nov., isolated from the respiratory tract of prairie voles (Microtus ochrogaster).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mycoplasma microti sp. nov.
Mycoplasma microti (mi.cro'ti. M.L. n. Microtus a genus of field vole; M.L. gen. n. microti of Microtus)
Cells predominantly coccoid in shape, varying from 300 to 500 nm in diameter.
Cells devoid of cell wall and surrounded only by cytoplasmic membrane.
Colonies on solid medium with 0.8% agar exhibit typical fried-egg forms.
Does not hydrolyse arginine nor urea.
Serum or sterol required for sustained growth.
Serologically distinct from all other established Mycoplasma species.
Isolated from lung and nasopharyngeal secretions of prairie voles (Microtus ochrogaster).
The organism has been shown to be pathogenic for laboratory mice and rats, although pathogenicity for the prairie vole is not clearly established.
